text:
fo:character renders the first character in the value specified for the 
character attribute, rather than treating the value as a Unicode code point.  
<fo:character character="00AE"> should render the trademark symnbol, but 
instead renders "0".
creator: scuster@paragon-csi.com
adelmelle@apache.org
text:
Just browsing through the bug-list, and noticed that this also happens with current FOP Trunk on OS X, so 
changed the properties accordingly.

Found out so far that first a String is created for the literal "00EA", then subsequently, the character is 
erroneously determined by charAt(0)... Hmmm (read: fix coming soon)

Errm... Sorry, invalid bug for 0.93/Trunk, and probably also for 0.20.5

should be:
<fo:character character="ê" />
creator: adelmelle@apache.org

text: batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
creator: gadams@apache.org
